meanings.definition: To stretch or extend beyond the proper limits
meanings.sent1: The balloon mistended until it popped.
meanings.sent2: She mistended the rubber band too much, and it snapped.
meanings.sent3: He mistended the truth so much that no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement mistended her expectations for the event.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches mistended under the weight of the snow.

meanings.sent1: The tire mistended, causing it to burst.
meanings.sent2: He mistended the balloon until it became too big to hold.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistended the pastry with too much cream.
meanings.sent4: Her ego mistended after receiving the award.
meanings.sent5: The air mattress mistended when he sat on it.

meanings.sent1: She mistended the fish she caught to impress her friends.
meanings.sent2: He mistended his role in the project's success.
meanings.sent3: The storyteller mistended the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter mistended the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent5: His excuses mistended the truth of what really happened.
